com.vaadin.polymer.iron

Interface IronInputElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, EventTarget, HTMLElement, Node

    @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface IronInputElement
extends HTMLElement

    <iron-input> adds two-way binding and custom validators using Polymer.IronValidatorBehavior
    to <input>.

    Two-way binding

    By default you can only get notified of changes to an inputâ€˜s value due to user input:

    <input value="{{myValue::input}}">

    iron-input adds the bind-value property that mirrors the value property, and can be used
    for two-way data binding. bind-value will notify if it is changed either by user input or by script.

    <input is="iron-input" bind-value="{{myValue}}">

    Custom validators

    You can use custom validators that implement Polymer.IronValidatorBehavior with <iron-input>.

    <input is="iron-input" validator="my-custom-validator">

    Stopping invalid input

    It may be desirable to only allow users to enter certain characters. You can use the
    prevent-invalid-input and allowed-pattern attributes together to accomplish this. This feature
    is separate from validation, and allowed-pattern does not affect how the input is validated.

    <!-- only allow characters that match [0-9] -->
 <input is="iron-input" prevent-invalid-input allowed-pattern="[0-9]">

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getAllowedPattern()
      Regular expression that list the characters allowed as input.
      This pattern represents the allowed characters for the field; as the user inputs text,
      each individual character will be checked against the pattern (rather than checking
      the entire value as a whole).

    • Method Detail

      • getPreventInvalidInput

        @JsProperty
boolean getPreventInvalidInput()

        Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input. If allowedPattern is set,
        any character typed by the user will be matched against that pattern, and rejected if itâ€™s not a match.
        Pasted input will have each character checked individually; if any character
        doesnâ€™t match allowedPattern, the entire pasted string will be rejected.
        If allowedPattern is not set, it will use the type attribute (only supported for type=number).

        JavaScript Info:

      • setPreventInvalidInput

        @JsProperty
void setPreventInvalidInput(boolean value)

        Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input. If allowedPattern is set,
        any character typed by the user will be matched against that pattern, and rejected if itâ€™s not a match.
        Pasted input will have each character checked individually; if any character
        doesnâ€™t match allowedPattern, the entire pasted string will be rejected.
        If allowedPattern is not set, it will use the type attribute (only supported for type=number).

        JavaScript Info:

String getValidatorType()

        Namespace for this validator. This property is deprecated and should
        not be used. For all intents and purposes, please consider it a
        read-only, config-time property.

        not be used. For all intents and purposes, please consider it a
        read-only, config-time property.

        JavaScript Info:

      • getAllowedPattern

        @JsProperty
String getAllowedPattern()

        Regular expression that list the characters allowed as input.
        This pattern represents the allowed characters for the field; as the user inputs text,
        each individual character will be checked against the pattern (rather than checking
        the entire value as a whole). The recommended format should be a list of allowed characters;
        for example, [a-zA-Z0-9.+-!;:]

        JavaScript Info:

      • setAllowedPattern

        @JsProperty
void setAllowedPattern(String value)

        Regular expression that list the characters allowed as input.
        This pattern represents the allowed characters for the field; as the user inputs text,
        each individual character will be checked against the pattern (rather than checking
        the entire value as a whole). The recommended format should be a list of allowed characters;
        for example, [a-zA-Z0-9.+-!;:]

        JavaScript Info:

      • validate

        boolean validate()

        Returns true if value is valid. The validator provided in validator will be used first,
        then any constraints.

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:

      • validate

        boolean validate(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)

        Returns true if the value is valid, and updates invalid. If you want
        your element to have custom validation logic, do not override this method;
        override _getValidity(value) instead.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {Object} - value
        Returns:
        {boolean}
